New Records: Australia became the first nation to concede more than 200 in four consecutive T20 internationals
Key Match Events: Tim David hit a boundary on the final ball to seal a six-wicket win for Australia
Captain Mitch Marsh scored 72 off 44 balls to lay the foundation for the Australian chase
Rachin Ravindra scored 68 off 35 balls, including six sixes
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Smith was left out of the Australian XI, sparking doubts over his participation in the T20 World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's total of 3-215 was their highest score in the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy opener
The Australian team won the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy opener in dramatic fashion
